doc:
John Baskcomb https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Baskcomb 0 John Baskcomb (7 February 1916 – 29 March 2000) was an English character actor who made numerous television and film appearances over a 35-year period. He was the son of the founder of the Bank of England Opera and Dramatic Society and was educated at Croydon High School for Boys. He then appeared on stage in repertory theatre in Croydon and Henley-on-Thames and in clubs, pantomimes and concert parties. He made appearances in numerous British television plays and series including; Doctor Who (Terror of the Autons), The Saint, Softly, Softly and Poldark and he played the role of Cardinal Wolsey in The Six Wives of Henry VIII (1970). His film roles included Oliver! (uncredited), Chitty Chitty Bang Bang (uncredited), Battle of Britain, Dad's Army and Omen III: The Final Conflict. John_Baskcomb ( 7_February_1916 – 29_March_2000 ) was an_English_character_actor who made numerous_television_and_film_appearances over a_35-year_period . He made appearances in numerous_British_television_plays and series_including ; Doctor Who ( Terror of the_Autons ) , The_Saint_,_Softly_,_Softly_and_Poldark and he played the_role of Cardinal_Wolsey in The_Six_Wives of Henry_VIII_(_1970_) . His_film_roles included Oliver ! (_uncredited_) , Chitty_Chitty_Bang_Bang_(_uncredited_) , Battle of Britain , Dad 's_Army_and_Omen_III : The_Final_Conflict .
